item.title: Press
item.description: Below are different links to articles I have been quoted or featured in. Quoted August 2022 Argentina judiciary targeted by new ‘Play’ ransomware group Dominican Republic refuses to pay ransom after attack on agrarian institute July 2022 California college with 12,500 students knocked offline in cyberattack ICYMI: Critical Cisco RCE Bug, Microsoft Breaks Down Hive, SHI Cyberattack June 2022 May 2022 India’s SpiceJet Strands Planes After Being Hit By Ransomware Attack At Swimlane, Security Analysts Are Creative Thinkers Agricultural equipment manufacturer hit by ransomware attack | #malware | #ransomware April 2022 Increasing Cyber Risks with Russia’s War on Ukraine March 2022 Russia is About to Hack Your Energy Source.

item.title: Open Source Projects
item.description: Below is a list of open-source projects I have started or contributed heavily to: speedtweet This docker-compose project will check your internet speed against a specified threshold and if below it will tweet at the provided account about your current internet speeds. Type: Docker slack-url-utils slack-url-utils is a slash command utility for Slack that obfuscates, deobfuscates, gets DNS information, and submits IOCs to AlienVault for a given URL. Type: Docker rudder A Python package to run commands remotely on Windows, macOS or *nix systems using PowerShell Remoting/WinRM or SSH.

item.title: Presentations
item.description: I have included a list below of my previous presentations and any relevant links. This will be continually updated moving forward: Presentation Slides Making MITRE ATT&CK Actionable (gif) (pdf) py-ews: A cross platform python package to interact with Exchange Web Services Hunting Phish Kits PowerShell vs Python: A side-by-side comparison Basics of Incident Handling Securing Windows with Group Policy atomic-operator: Atomic Red Team Python Execution Framework Past Presentations Hunting PhishKits - 2022 CactusCon atomic-operator: Atomic Red Team Python Execution Framework - 2022 CactusCon Making MITRE ATT&CK Actonable - WWHF Weekly Showcase - 2022 Securing Windows with Group Policy - 2021 CircleCityCon Hunting Phish Kits - 2021 BSidesKC Securing Windows with Group Policy - 2021 WildWest Hackin Fest Deadwood Making MITRE ATT&CK Actionable - 2020 Hacker Halted vOPCDE #3 - Search & Delete: eDiscovery using EWS & Graph APIs py-ews: A cross platform python package to interact with Exchange Web Services - 2019 BSidesSTL Hunting Phish Kits - 2019 DerbyCon PowerShell vs Python: A side-by-side comparison - 2019 BSides Springfield (Missouri) - No Video SECURING WINDOWS WITH (SOME) GROUP POLICY – 2018 SHOWMECON SECURING WINDOWS WITH (SOME) GROUP POLICY – 2018 BSIDESKC MOTIVATIONS & TACTICS OF PHISHING – 2017 MORENET ANNUAL CONFERENCE SECURING WINDOWS WITH GROUP POLICY – 2017 DERBYCON BASICS OF INCIDENT RESPONSE – 2017 BSIDESSTL (2) HALF DAY POWERSHELL TRAINING COURSE FOR 80+ - 2017 MU VET MED PPRT: POWERSHELL PHISHING RESPONSE TOOLKIT – 2016 SHOWMECON PPRT: POWERSHELL PHISHING RESPONSE TOOLKIT – 2016 CIRCLE CITY CON SECURING WINDOWS WITH GROUP POLICY – 2015 MORENET ANNUAL CONFERENCE

item.title: About
item.description: My name is Josh Rickard and I am a creator and automator of things. I’m an experienced IT & DFIR (Digital Forensics & Incident Response) professional that loves to automate and release open-source tools to help the Information Security community. I like long walks through binary trees, Python & PowerShell riding, writing romantic experiences about code, git prune all branches, and deep sea phishing. ## Experience Senior Detection Validation Engineer Red Canary / Colorado / October 2022 to January 2023 Due to a reduction in force my position was let go.
